discourse_list.title: Will MakerDAO stop vesting MKR to its Core Units? - Drinks w/MakerDAO Delegates

content.content: Why MIP77, 78, 79 and StarkNet Core Units MKR vesting Polls are in Danger of Failing In this episode of the newly rebranded, “Drinks w/MakerDAO Delegates”, @ultraschuppi @rspa of Flipside Crypto, and I take a look at why the current Governance Polls for MakerDAO Delegates MIP Set and why the Poll for MKR Compensation for StarkNet Engineering Core Unit. We really enjoyed discussing everything from Schuppi Chopping Wood  tactics for outlasting the upcoming Cold Winter, to Raphael’s adventures through South Carolina. We hope you enjoy this episode as much as we did.  Not Financial Advice This Content is for entertainment and informational purposes only, you should not construe any such information or other material as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice. Nothing contained on the FlipFlopFlap YouTube Channel constitutes a solicitation, recommendation, endorsement, or offer by @ultraschuppi a.k.a, Tim Schuppner @ElProgreso a.k.a, Frank Cruz @rspa a.k.a, Raphael Spannocchi, Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC, Flipside Crypto, or any third party service provider to buy or sell any cryptocurrencies, securities, or other financial instruments. Nothing in this YouTube Video constitutes professional and/or financial advice.  The Tastings El Pro: Niemiecki Pils Piwa, German Pils, Krakow, Poland   4      Tasting Notes: Clean, floral and spicy aroma of noble hops  Schuppi:  Tuborg Grøn, European Pale Lager, Copenhagen, Denmark   4      Tasting Notes: nice amber color, tastes of malt and pureness.  Raphael:  Mint Tea from South Carolina, United States   3.5      Its a great pickup drink after a long night of drinking booze    Relevant Link to JokerDAO Proposal:  Using jokedao for soft consensus in governance - #11 by rspa
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses the current Governance Polls for MakerDAO Delegates MIP Set and why the Poll for MKR Compensation for StarkNet Engineering Core Unit might fail. The post also includes a podcast where the hosts discuss various topics, including the MakerDAO proposal. The post also includes a disclaimer that the content is for entertainment and informational purposes only and should not be construed as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Great discussion, guys. Thanks for your kind words, although I can’t take all the credit, multiple people provided helpful feedback on the proposals whilst they were being written. For the record, I’m not discouraged. This is Governance in action, and the discussion has been respectful on the whole. If these proposals fail, we’ve at least started a discussion, and hopefully, someone else can pick up the torch and make a better proposal which is acceptable to Governance.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
